timeline.bodyText:
and 163 other dependency paths
instead
and other 163 dependency paths
timeline.author: elharo

timeline.bodyText: This could be simpler if this method only formatted a single jar. Then you'd only need one loop in LinkageChecker.main and you wouldn't have to build an intermediate list.
timeline.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: The intermediate ImmutableSet is for deduplication logic.
replies.author: suztomo

timeline.bodyText: You don't need this set, just print each jar as you find it. That should also make the order more predictable.
timeline.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: That would explode the number of lines in the output. We need this de-duplication logic. When there's 100 linkage errors on 100 classes from a JAR file, this should not print the dependency path to the that JAR file 100 times.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: OK, that makes sense. Does the order of output matter though?
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText:
No, the order does not matter.
(Guava’s ImmutableSet guarantees a deterministic iteration order, which is not affected by JVM implementation.)
replies.author: suztomo
